decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruption spells while setting up win conditions with cards like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries and Doomsday. Glarb, Calamity's Augur serves as the commander that provides card advantage and control elements to help maintain dominance on the battlefield. The deck has a good mix of interaction spells like Counterspell, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponents' plans while also having powerful draw spells like Brainstorm and Intuition to keep the card advantage in your favor. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue and outplay opponents through efficient control and manipulation of the game state.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Elminster serves as the commander, providing access to Blue and White spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck includes a variety of instants, sorceries, and enchantments to counter threats, remove creatures, and draw cards. It also features lands that can produce multiple colors of mana to support the deck's spells. By outlasting the opponent and maintaining control of the battlefield, the deck aims to grind down the opponent's resources and eventually establish dominance. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's plays while advancing towards victory with careful planning and resource management.

This deck revolves around the aggressive playstyle of Amalia Benavides Aguirre, utilizing a variety of low-cost creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a focus on gaining incremental advantage through lifegain effects and creature recursion, the deck aims to maintain a constant presence on the battlefield while draining the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in recurring key cards from the graveyard. By leveraging the synergies between various creatures and spells, the deck looks to apply constant pressure and close out the game efficiently before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on utilizing Emmara, Soul of the Accord's ability to create tokens and go wide on the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It includes mana ramp cards like Avacyn's Pilgrim and Birds of Paradise to accelerate into powerful threats like Brightglass Gearhulk and Endurance. The deck also runs disruptive elements like Armageddon and Ravages of War to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep the pressure on. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and card advantage engines like Skullclamp, the deck aims to close out games quickly by snowballing its advantage and outpacing the opponent's defenses.

The deck revolves around utilizing fast, aggressive creatures along with disruptive elements to quickly overpower the opponent in a one-on-one match. With Deadpool as the commander, the deck includes various removal spells, hand disruption cards, and aggressive creatures like Nethergoyf and Troll of Khazad-dûm to apply pressure. The deck also includes powerful cards like Recurring Nightmare and Animate Dead to bring back key creatures from the graveyard, as well as ways to generate card advantage through cards like Skullclamp and Seasoned Pyromancer. By combining aggression with disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to control the board and close out the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with a variety of control spells and removal. Kefka, Court Mage serves as a powerful commander that can generate card advantage and provide a win condition on its own. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Brazen Borrower, along with powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Toxic Deluge. The deck also includes counterspells such as Force of Negation and Spell Pierce to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's spells. By combining aggression with disruption, this deck aims to apply constant pressure while keeping the opponent off balance and unable to stabilize.

This deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and utilizing the Partner commanders to their fullest potential. By combining Rograkh's low cost and Silas Renn's artifact recursion abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick threats and disruptive spells. The mana base is structured to support a variety of colors, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities. The card selection is curated to include a mix of efficient creature removal, card draw, tutor effects, and combo pieces to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game swiftly. Overall, the strategy revolves around building up a board presence and leveraging synergies between cards to outmaneuver the opponent in a duel format.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Partner commanders, Ravos, Soultender and Thrasios, Triton Hero, to create a fast and aggressive game plan. The deck includes a variety of mana ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to accelerate early plays. The deck also includes powerful tutor cards like Demonic Tutor and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key combo pieces or threats. Additionally, the deck includes a number of disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Mother of Runes to control the board and protect its own creatures. The goal of the deck is to quickly build a threatening board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan.
